title.rendered: UP vs Mumbai, India Women’s League 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

UP: Devika Vaidya, Alyssa Healy (c & wk), Shweta Sehrawat, Kiran Navgire, Tahlia McGrath, Deepti Sharma, Grace Harris, Simran Shaikh, Sophie Ecclestone, Anjali Sarvani, Rajeshwari Gayakwad

Mumbai: Hayley Matthews, Yastika Bhatia (wk), Nat Sciver-Brunt, Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Amelia Kerr, Pooja Vastrakar, Issy Wong, Amanjot Kaur, Humaira Kazi, Jintimani Kalita, Saika Ishaque

Pitch Report

Venue: Brabourne Stadium, Mumbai

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 165

2nd innings average score: 209

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: 67%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Hayley Matthews has been a favourite for captaincy in fantasy leagues for reason. She has scored 156 runs at an average of 78 and scalped two three-wicket hauls, opening in both aspects of the game.

Led by Saika Ishaque (nine wickets at a strike rate of 6.7), Mumbai bowlers have been on fire in the tournament, bundling out their opponents in all the matches so far.

Nat Sciver-Brunt’s recent numbers are excellent: she has scored two thirties and four fifties in the last nine matches. She also has three wickets in the tournament.

Amelia Kerr has scalped 17 wickets in the last 10 matches and has scored less than 10 runs only once in eight innings.

Sophie Ecclestone hasn’t gone wicketless this year, grabbing 21 wickets in nine matches.

Devika Vaidya opened the batting in the previous game and scored 36*. To add to that, she also bowls, scaling up the probability to provide more points.

Alyssa Healy has four fifties and a thirty in the last nine competitive matches. Besides averaging 54 during this period (378 runs), she has collected points for four stumpings and a catch.

Rajeshwari Gayakwad has featured in the Best11 in each of the last three matches.

Spinners have grabbed 68% of the wickets in the last three matches at the venue.
